main event: A circular object was observed exhibiting erratic lateral motion in Charleston, West Virginia, on May 6, 1961.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 5 minutes,The object faded out in the southern direction,There was a discussion on the possibility that weather balloons could account for the sighting,The observer noted a pulsating forward motion of the object,The report indicated a good reliability of the observer who was a sales engineer.
